text: Hi guys! I'm running into an issue with the blog templates. For some reason all the CSS styles in that page are merged together in a `combined_css_xx#somehashvalue` that is not  updating even when I update the CSS files that should normally be in that page.
Anyone knows, please, why the merge happens and what do I need to stop it?

yea, I’ve  had that happen before Ady - specifically tends to happen with blogs more commonly.

It will eventually clear the cache usually within 30 minutes.

In the mean time one way to get around it during development is to use ?hs_debug_mode=true

<@U6GNQ7JBU> and <@U6TBZ66FN> work on the cacheing and might be able to improve this if you can give them some details
So it's a feature not a bug...
I've added the parameter from above and the stylesheets are linked properly as I declared them in the template instead of being combined
no, it’s a bug. It’s not supposed to stay cached, but the feature is that it is cached in a combined minified way.
correct, that’s a way you can view your changes as you develop without waiting on cache to clear
So the cache is supposed to be there for speeding the loading of the CSS?
yes that as well as JS

<@U7VDLFJL8> Is you CSS an external file? We do not have good way to track changes for external files. If it is a internal CSS, we should be able detect the changes and update the combined css quickly.
